info.name: Staff Management System API
info.description:
Complete API collection for Staff Management System with Enhanced Access Control - System Admin Only Center Management, Bulk Announcements, Restricted User Access, Multi-Center Support, Persian Date Support, Complete Employee Management

ðŸ½ï¸ **Meal Structure**:
- BaseMeal: Food groups (e.g., "Ú†Ù„Ùˆ Ø®ÙˆØ±Ø´Øª Ø³Ø¨Ø²ÛŒ") - created via /api/food/meals/
- DailyMenuMealOption: Actual meals with prices, quantities, etc. (e.g., "Ø¨Ø§ Ø¨Ø±Ù†Ø¬ Ø®Ø§Ø±Ø¬ÛŒ", "Ø¨Ø§ Ø¨Ø±Ù†Ø¬ Ø§ÛŒØ±Ø§Ù†ÛŒ") - managed via admin panel for each DailyMenu
- Restaurant: Restaurant model with center association - managed via /api/food/restaurants/
- DailyMenu: Daily menu with restaurant, date, and base_meals - managed via admin panel
- Reservations use meal_option (DailyMenuMealOption) - not base_meal directly
- All prices, costs, and reports are based on DailyMenuMealOption
- DailyMenuMealOption has optional cancellation_deadline - if null, reservation can always be cancelled

ðŸ“… **Persian Date Support**: All dates in the system are automatically converted to Persian (Jalali) format in the admin panel and API responses.

ðŸ‘¥ **Multi-Center User Support**: Users can now belong to multiple centers. The API accepts both `center` (single, for backward compatibility) and `centers` (array) fields. User responses include `centers` (IDs), `center_names` (list of names), and `centers_detail` (full center objects).

ðŸ” **Access Control**:
- System Admin: Full access to all features
- Food Admin: Can manage meals and menus for any center, cannot manage centers
- HR Admin: Can manage announcements for any center, can create bulk announcements, cannot manage centers
- Employee: Can see and manage data for all their assigned centers (multiple centers support)

ðŸ“Š **Features**:
- Multi-center support (users can belong to multiple centers)
- Guest reservations
- Bulk announcements
- Persian date display
- Role-based access control
- Complete employee workflow management
- Personal and guest reservation management
- Menu viewing and reservation system
- Meal options with prices
- Comprehensive API documentation

request.description:
Get current authenticated user information. Response includes:
- `centers`: Array of center IDs the user belongs to
- `center_name`: First center name (for backward compatibility)
- `center_names`: Array of all center names
- `centers_detail`: Full details of all assigned centers

Users can belong to multiple centers. Access control is based on all assigned centers.

item.name: Get Meals by Date for Food Admin

request.description: Get list of meals that exist in daily menus for a specific date. Food admin can only see meals of restaurants that belong to their assigned centers. Returns only meal data without restaurant information. No pagination. Used for menu management: first select date, then show meals if they exist in menu for that date.

item.name: Update Daily Menu by Date for Food Admin

request.description: Add or update a single meal with its options in daily menu for a specific date. Requires restaurant_id, base_meal_id, and meal_options array with title, description (optional), price, and quantity. If the meal already exists in the menu, its options will be replaced. Food admin can only update menus for restaurants that belong to their assigned centers. System admin can update any restaurant's menu. Returns complete daily menu data with all meals and meal options.

Remove a base meal and all its meal options from daily menu for a specific date. Food admin can only remove meals from restaurants that belong to their assigned centers. System admin can remove meals from any restaurant. Returns complete daily menu data after removal.

item.name: List Base Meals (All Centers for Admins)

request.description: Get list of base meals (food groups). Each base meal can have multiple meal options with different prices.

item.name: Create Base Meal for Center 1 (Food Admin)

request.description: Create a base meal (food group). After creation, you need to add meal options (DailyMenuMealOption) via admin panel when creating/editing a DailyMenu. The 'restaurant' field should be the ID of a Restaurant object. The 'center' will be automatically set from the restaurant.

request.description: Create a base meal (food group). After creation, add meal options (DailyMenuMealOption) via admin panel when creating/editing a DailyMenu.
Get details of a base meal. Meal options (DailyMenuMealOption) are managed per DailyMenu via admin panel.

request.description: Get simplified daily menus for employee's assigned centers on specific date (supports multiple centers). Returns only essential information: restaurant (id, name, center), date, jalali_date, is_available, and meals array. Each meal in meals array contains: id, title, and options array. Each option contains: id, title, price, quantity, and available_quantity. Clean and simple structure for easy frontend integration.
